value.documentation:
=head2 Sorting comparator by index id

Used for sort, compares two index ids:
 
 1.2.3 < 1.2.4
 1.2 < 1.2.4
 1.2.3 = 1.2.3
 2.0 > 1.9.9
 1.11 > 1.1
 etc.

=cut
value.title: by_idx

value.documentation:
=head2 Recursively process the index tree

 Parameters:
 $node 		: the current node (hash with value and children elements)
 $path 		: the current path (used in recursion)
 $level		: the current depth
 $index_pos	: the parent's index position

=cut
value.title: recurse

value.documentation:
=head1 Some class doing stuff in Perl

In this class, we do some crazy Moose stuff.

=cut
value.title: MooseClass

value.documentation:
=head2 This method does cool things.

B<Here's some Moose trivia:>

Remember to always keep the method declaration in one line, 
like this:
 
 method some_method(Int $i) { ...

NEVER MOVE THE OPENING BRACKET OR PARAMETERS TO THE NEXT LINE.

 method some_method(Int $i) 
 { ...

Otherwise, bad things happen in Moose-land.

 Parameters:
 $i : A number

 Returns:
 That number $i, incremented.

=cut
value.title: some_method

value.documentation:
=head2 Hiding Source Code

Sometimes, we might not want to show all code in the documentation.
This is achieved using the 

 ## show source 

and 

 ## hide source 

comments.

=cut
value.title: not_necessary_to_show_code

value.documentation:
=head1 Tree with named nodes

Extends the standard tree class to have named nodes

=cut
value.title: Tools::NamedTree

value.documentation: # name of this node
value.title: 'name'

value.documentation:
=head2 Check if a named path exists in this tree

 Parameters:
 $path : an array of path elements. the first element is compared
         to $self->{name}, the following ones to the children
 
 Returns: 
 The NamedTree corresponding to the path, or undef if no such tree was found

=cut
value.title: has_path

value.documentation:
=head2 Make a child node with a given path (unless it already exists)

 Parameters: 
 $path : an array of path elements. the first element is compared
         to $self->{name}, the following ones to the children
 $value : a value to append to the new child
 
 Returns: 
 The NamedTree corresponding to the path
 
=cut
value.title: make_path

value.documentation:
=head2 Convert tree to JSON-compatible tree.

 Returns:
 untyped, JSON-compatible tree (removing the parent links)
=cut
value.title: TO_JSON

value.documentation:
=head2 restore parent links and blessings after serializing to JSON

 Parameters:
 $hash : JSON-compatible hash (see TO_JSON)

 Returns:
 $self
=cut
value.title: FROM_JSON

Make a child node with a given path (unless it already exists)
restore parent links and blessings after serializing to JSON

value.documentation:
=head1 Perl Library Indexer

Create an index of perl files that allows retrieval of declarations
and references to these.

=cut
value.title: Tools::PerlIndex

value.documentation:
=head1 Constructor
 
 Parse a directory of perl modules into an index.

=cut
value.title: new

value.documentation:
=head1 Split a perl identifier name into a path, a file name and a declaration 
name

 Parameters: 
 $source : the identifier
 $mustexist : 1 if the identifier must exist
 
 Returns: 
 a declaration record:
 {
 	file => <filename>,
 	location => line number,
 	
 }

=cut
value.title: splitPath

value.documentation:
=head1 Get all references to an identifier 

 Parameters:
 $self : a PerlIndex
 $id : identifier
 
 Returns
 
 ARRAYREF to all references including file, line number, and match string
 
 [ { file => ..., location => ..., match => ..., ppidoc => PPI document, 
 	ppitok => PPI start token,
   }, ... ]

=cut
value.title: getReferences

value.documentation:
=head2 Search find all module dependencies

 Parameters:
 $self              : the self object
 $external_only=0   : 1 to only list packages not found in the index
 $core_minversion=5 : minimum core version to contain the package

 Returns:
 {
 	package => [ 
 		references
 	]
 }
=cut
value.title: getDependencies

value.documentation:
=head1 Search for identifiers using regular expressions

 Parameters:
 $self : a PerlIndex
 $expr : a regular expression
 $type : undef, or restriction to a type
 
 Returns:
 An ARRAYREF to a list of declarations 

=cut
value.title: searchIdentifiers
Split a perl identifier name into a path, a file name and a declaration
Get all references to an identifier
Search for identifiers using regular expressions

value.documentation:
=head1 Perl Parser ##0
This package splits perl code into code, comments and POD code.
=cut
value.title: Tools::PerlParser

value.documentation:

See above for supported states.
=cut
value.title: setHandler

value.documentation:
=head2 Function to write out parsed source code, comment or POD comments
Variable $current contains a buffer with the parsed source. This function 
prints and formats its contents according to the current state.
=cut
value.title: flushcurrent

value.documentation:
=head2 Main parser function
Crude line by line parser to separate lines with comments only,
code lines and pod lines.

 Parameters:
 $filename : the name of the source file to parse

=cut
value.title: parse

value.title: get_contents_tree

value.documentation:
=head2 PPI::Find filter for declarations

 Parameters:
 $cur : a PPI::Token

 Returns:
 1 if element fits the criteria
 0 if element does not fit
 undef if children do not need to be looked at.
 See also PPI::Find -> &wanted

=cut

=cut
value.title: get_title_and_type

value.documentation:
=head2 Get the documentation directly preceding a PPI Element

 Parameters:
 $el : the element

 Returns:
 The first pod block in front of this statement, or all comments
 up to the first element that is not whitespace. If no pod or comments
 are found up to the first non-whitespace element, we return undef
 
=cut
value.title: get_documentation

 $n : a subtree to append

value.title: add_child_node

value.documentation:
=head2 Traverse tree top to bottom

 Parameters:
 $c : a coderef that might return something for each node

 Returns:
 An array containing all values $c->($v) for all values $v in the tree

=cut
value.title: traverse

value.documentation:
=head2 Traverse tree top to bottom, passing the value by reference

 Parameters:
 $c : a coderef that might return something for each node

 Returns:
 An array containing all values $c->($v) for all values $v in the tree

=cut
value.title: traverse_update
